chargeHist.descr: Possession of a Firearm by Adjudicated Delinquent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Orion E Everett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Intimidation of a Victim [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).
  • Possession of A Firearm by Adjudicated Delinquent, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
16 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.
Concurrent with: with Count 2

(Case called at 1:34 PM) 
Defendant Orion E Everett with Attorney Erika Amundson.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defense outlines agreement for the Court.  Defendant acknowledges the Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form.  Defendant advised of the elements of the offenses to which he will plead.  Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Felony Intimidation of a Victim (Domestic Abuse), and Count 2: Possession of a Firearm by Adjudicated Delinquent.  Court accepts pleas and finds Defendant guilty.  Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.  Counsel make statements regarding the agreement.  Court withholds sentence and order 3 years of probation with the following conditions:
E.R.E.
